intro: Peucedanum decursivum, commonly known as the creeping cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, hairy stems and finely divided leaves. Its small white or greenish-white flowers appear in umbrella-like clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Peucedanum decursivum is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in moist, well-drained environments.
